intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. vestitum, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally hairy and have a serrated edge, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in open habitats and is adapted to temperate climates.
